page.title: 07MEAT PROCESSING-DUKINFIELD
page.content: The only slaughter house in the whole area is Dixon's bacon and pork processing factory. Every week 5-6 thousand pigs are slaughtered. These pigs come not only from the surrounding areas of Lancashire, Yorkshire and Cheshire but also from Lincolnshire and as far away as Scotland. Once the animals arrive they are slaughtered and jointed. Joints are delivered to outlets such as butchers and manufacturers of meat products; pork pies, sausages, cured ham, etc. About 180 people are employed within the factory. A fleet of heavy trucks is used to transport the goods to Manchester, Yorkshire, Cheshire and North Wales. A small number of trucks are used for local retail deliveries.
